 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲתַר‎</span> **noun masculine** ==place== (so Egyptian Aramaic, Nabataean, Palmyrene; [[BDB#Vg|ᵑ9]]; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***place***; Zinjirli <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אשר‎</span> [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>229 f.</sup>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***footstep***; compare Hebrew <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲשׁוּר‎</span> and below <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אֲשֶׁר‎</span>); — ***place*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** [[Dan.2.35|Dan 2:35]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎וְכָלאֲֿחַר לָאהִֿשְׁתְּכַח לְהוֺן‎</span>, [[Ezra.5.15|Ezra 5:15]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎וּבֵית אֱלָהָא יִתְבְנֵא עַלאַֿתְרֵהּ‎</span>, [[Ezra.6.3|Ezra 6:3]]; [[Ezra.6.5|Ezra 6:5]]; [[Ezra.6.7|Ezra 6:7]]. Hence 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בָּאתַר‎</span> ([[Dan.7.6|Dan 7:6]] [[BDB#Baer|Baer]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בָּתַר‎</span>) ***after*** (literally ***in the track of:*** so Zinjirli <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎באשר‎</span> ([[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>160 f.</sup>, 170), Palmyrene, [[BDB#Vg|ᵑ9]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בָּתַר‎</span>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">), <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎בָּאתַר דְּנָה‎</span> ***after this***, [[Dan.7.6|Dan 7:6]]; [[Dan.7.7|Dan 7:7]], suffix [[Dan.2.39|Dan 2:39]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎וּבָֽתָרָךְ‎</span> and ***after*** thee. <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎אַתַּ֫רוּ‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נתר‎</span>.
